name: Boston Marriott Cambridge

reviews.text: Located close to MIT and the MBTA Red Line, it's an easy trip to Harvard or downtown. Staff have always been friendly on my many stays here. Very family friendly.
reviews.title: Comfortable and convenient

reviews.text: We stayed here while moving our son into college, and planned a few extra days to sightsee.
reviews.title: Convenient location, comfortable rooms

reviews.text: The location is fantastic--you can get to the "T" station without going outdoors if the weather is bad. The transportation from the airport on the silver line and red line was a breeze even with all the luggage (and cheap!) While there was a lot of construction going on in front of the hotel, the noise was not heard once inside the rooms. A very short walk to the river and MIT campus, short T ride to Harvard Square or downtown Boston, trolley pickup across the street, plenty of good restaurants close by made this a perfect place to stay.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent three nights here recently while visiting our daughter. Had a horrific drive from New Jersey due to heavy rain. We were happy to finally arrive and be greeted by a very pleasant valet/bellman. Check-in was quick and painless. We had a room on the 19th floor that was clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Great Rest

reviews.text: Hotel is in a good location with a Red Line T stop right outside. Many restaurants nearby, a Starbucks in the lobby.
reviews.title: A great Marriot hotel
Very good hotel for MIT, Kendall Square with easy access to T
reviews.text: The Cambridge Marriott is a great choice if you're visiting MIT, the Kendall Square area or other parts of Cambridge. With a Red Line stop right outside, it's also convenient to Harvard Square and many parts of Boston. It's well maintained with nice rooms. Many of the rooms have great view of the Charles River and Boston. The hotel has a nice restaurant and bar and a Starbuck's. The rate can be quite high (over $300), but good deals can be found, too.

We stayed here for a weekend event at MIT. I did a lot of research and boy did it pay off. I had requested a standard view room with two queen sized beds when I made our reservation. Upon check in I was told that the only thing available was a room with one king. There were 4 of us so I was a bit panicked at first. The front desk was able to assure me that we would all actually fit a bit better here as we could fit a roll away bed in addition to a queen sized pull out sofa and the king sized bed. The room was perfect and apparently we had been upgraded to a river view room!!! The view of Boston across the Charles at sunset and night was beautiful.
reviews.title: Will Stay Here Again and Again!

reviews.text: The hotel was literally steps from MIT. I could watch my son exit the building 15 floors below, cross the street and be on campus.
reviews.title: Excellent choice, but expensive

reviews.text: We did not rent a car, nor did I ever wish we had! The subway stop was in the hotel's courtyard...talk about convenient. Harvard was two stops "outbound" and we were in Boston within 10 minutes. We decided to purchase tickets for one of the sightseeing trolleys from the extremely helpful hotel's concierge and discovered that there was a stop right in front of the hotel.
reviews.title: Expensive hotel but worth its location

reviews.text: In all, I cannot imagine staying anywhere else when visiting MIT.Our room was reasonably priced, convenient, clean and very comfortable! If our son ends up as a full time student there, we will make this hotel our home away from home each time we visit him.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Hotel.

reviews.text: If you want to be close to MIT (like us) this hotel is the prime choice. Metro station is next door, as well as Coop logo store and many other great places.
reviews.title: Location, location, outrageous!

reviews.text: Couple of helpful notes: there is a hideous construction going on right outside the main entrance-so ask before you book! Also, no restaurant on premises, only Starbucks. Lobby is rather small and on a rainy days gets crammed with questionable characters. Hair dryer note in a previous review is correct: it works couple of minutes at a time... Still, bedding and service and staff are all Marriott great quality. Used the points for our stay, and if you don't book way in advance you will be stuck with $429 per night price tag.
reviews.title: Bring your own blow dryer

reviews.text: I stayed here one night as part of a wedding weekend. Overall, this hotel is great, and the location is perfect - close enough to the city to get to places easily, right on the T but not in the hustle and bustle of things. I'd stay there again, except I'd BRING MY OWN BLOW DRYER! Seriously. I rarely review hotels, but I felt so strongly that these blow dryers, well, blow, that I had to say something here about it. My friend who I shared the room with could have repeatedly blown on my hair and made it dry quicker. I asked another long haired friend who stayed in the hotel what she thought, and she agreed, worst...blow dryers...EVER! So go, because the room is nice, the bed is comfy, everything is clean, the people are so accommodating. Just be sure that if you need your hair dried the same day you wash it, that you bring your own hair dryer.
reviews.title: A standard overpriced business hotel

reviews.text: It is nothing more than a always-crowed business hotel. The subway red line runs under it. Its great location makes it a favorite lodging place for local universities and companies. Unless your company pays your room or you have a corporate code, I do not recommend it. It's simply overpriced. If you don't get a room at the top few floor, you barely have a view of the river or the city. As reviewed by other travelers, I also find the rooms missing amenities.
reviews.title: Fantastik view from the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The parking is $24 for overnight.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.text: We stayed one night for dinner and drinks with friends in Cambridge. I selected this hotel based on location and cancellation policy...by 6pm that night. Location was easy to get to. Public parking garage attached. Valet was full and it seemed more of a nuisance and wait for those travelers trying to get their cars. Checkin was very slow; it appeared the hotel was full with a wedding and business function and the staff seemed frazzled. Our room was fine; clean and your typical Marriott hotel room. We paid a little extra for a river view which was nice in the evening. We ordered room service as well which arrived promptly in the morning and it was hot and decent. Tips: Skip valet - parking in garage is easy and cheaper. Hotel online reservation will not guarantee you a king bed - it's king OR 2 doubles. So I called couple days before check in and found out that we were put in a double room and clerk moved us to king. Also skip the virtual concierge option, I had pre ordered some food/ drink items for room on checkin and nothing was there. No biggie!
reviews.title: Average stay but nice option

reviews.text: While visiting Boston, there are many options right in town. Those options can tend to be expensive or crowded. The good news is that Boston has a great subway system, and you can leverage that by staying just outside of town, like at the Marriott Cambridge.
reviews.title: Good home base to see Boston

reviews.text: The hotel has 25 or more stories and offers a great view of Boston. There is a subway "T" station right outdoors (Kendall) so in 10 mins u can be right in the city. There's a pretty good sandwich/pizza place called Cosi across the street.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are smallish, but okay. Very clean and newer. There's a sports bar right in the lobby and a Starbucks. The rooms have a safe, and there's wireless and wired Internet for a fee (free if youre Marriott elite). There's a snack room in the lobby and often they have free cookies there. You can ask for a fridge and stock up. There's a small food court just off of the lobby. The elevators are quick. The staff is pleasant. There is both valet and park yourself parking tho I think both are about $30 per night. It's very close to I93 when it's time to leave.
reviews.title: You're paying for the location and convenience

reviews.text: We stayed at the Boston Marriott Cambridge last week. Had a beautiful room with a great view. Staff was excellent -- very helpful and pleasant. Location is very convenient to all public transportation including the T (underground rail system). Tour trolley just across from the rear entrance. Farmers market just down the street. Shuttle bus nearby to Galleria shopping mall. Lots of very interesting and pleasant guests. Starbucks on the premises. The lobby is what a hotel lobby should be -- vibrant with lots of great conversation going on. The only thing that let the hotel down is the Champions restaurant. It's great for breakfast. But for dinner there was very poor service (waitstaff disappeared), burgers were raw even though we asked for well done. Dinner menu selection really bad. The restaurant doesn't know what it is -- a sports bar or restaurant. Such a shame they just closed the lovely restaurant that was on the 2nd floor. We had to go out to dinner every night because Champtions was so bad. Otherwise the hotel was great and we would definitely go there again!
reviews.title: All around very good!

reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 days earlier this month. The view is fantastic! The room was very nice and quiet. It was great having a Starbucks in the lobby. The Kendall T-stop is right at lobby level. Very convenient for getting around Boston. Parking is a bit expensive but it's the city so parking is going to be expensive.
reviews.title: Great Place To Stay

reviews.text: The bed was very comfortable. There was a desk and a sofa (pull out sleeper sofa). If you had more than 2 people in the room it would probably feel cramped. There was some construction going on but it wasn't too noisy. There are a few places to get breakfast or lunch right nearby - Au Bon Pain or COSI. There is a restaurant/bar in the lobby.
reviews.title: Comfy Cambridge Property.

reviews.text: Staff was very helpful when I had a question or needed help with something. there is a business center in the lobby with 3 computers and printers. Wifi is free in the lobby but not in the rooms. Wish they would make it free throughout the hotel.
reviews.title: great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I was back in the area I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Would have been a great location if subway worked

reviews.text: Spectacular river views from the south facing rooms high floor rooms of this hotel. Decor is Marriott recently re-done, and is pleasant and functional.Do like the light from the floor-to-ceiling windows.Convenience of being on the T red line is very valuable.This hotel is in a safe area, so it is fun to explore the local environs including MIT and the Charles riverfront area.
reviews.title: Enjoyable hotel near MIT

reviews.text: Literally on top of a T-stop. Striking view of Boston skyline from room on the 22nd floor! (Thank you for such a GREAT room!) Comfortable roll-away to accomodate our third teenager - big points...and room for the rest of us too! Desk clerk, concierge, housekeeper, bartender - all very friendly and welcoming! This is our second stay at this Marriott and should we be at MIT again - or have any other reason to visit Boston - this is where we'll stay!
reviews.title: Location, Room, Staff - Wonderful!

reviews.text: Parking is also very easy in the garage beside the hotel - connecting door from garage into hotel to avoid any weather issues, etc. $24/night to park is reasonable for the area. Many interesting restaurants nearby as well!
reviews.title: Great for MIT visit

reviews.text: Perfect location for a short visit with my kid to MIT. Right above the T, walking distance to campus and onsite restaurant and starbucks. Asked for a fridge and that was provided at no additional cost. But proximity comes at a price. Would've preferred the easier amenities of a family-friendly hotel. No low-cost breakfast, no free wi-fi and the parking rates made us decide to do Amtrak instead. Great bookstore downstairs and food court open everyday except Sun. Would stay again for location but wish more could be thrown in to make it an easier stay. Beds were Marriott's amazing quality, staff very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Decent Place

reviews.text: Stayed here four nights on a business trip. Room was nice and I had no problems either with the facilities or staff. If you want a view, ask for a higher floor. The hotel has 26 floors. There is not much in the way of things to do in the immediate vicinity of the hotel, but the Kendall subway station is right outside the front door. I used it to travel both into downtown Boston and up to Harvard Square. If you have a car, parking will cost you $24 a day if you park it yourself. Valet service is more.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable and a great location for MIT and Cambridge.

reviews.text: Great stay, front desk folks we're very accommodating, they went out of their way for a late night soda for me and didn't charge, that's A+ service! Two stops on the red line T to Harvard Square, it couldn't be easier.
reviews.title: Comfortable just not inspiring...!

reviews.text: Standard Marriott Hotel, right next to the 'T' (underground transit system) allowing easy access to both Harvard and the City of Boston.
reviews.title: Functional Hotel

reviews.text: Modern hotel with little atmosphere but with all you would expect of a Marriott hotel, small bar, Starbucks, clean rooms and friendly staff etc etc.
reviews.title: Lovely, room and high standard hotel with very friendly staff

reviews.text: About a 5 min train ride into the city centre, with direct access on the red line making it an easy trip.
reviews.title: great stay, very coinvenient

reviews.text: We would stay there again if visiting Boston.
reviews.title: nice and convenient hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights for a mini holiday to see Boston history and culture. The room was very spacious (easily accommodated our family of 4) and well equipped. Beds were very comfortable and everything was to a high standard, in good repair. We also enjoyed the bistro - really good and imaginative food in the evenings and very nice breakfast. Service was extremely helpful and friendly. Location was also great for seeing Boston and Cambridge. Really special was the beautiful large garden on the fourth floor, adjoining a nice pool, spa and gym. And their price was very competitive. Overall quality was at the top end of what I expect from my business travel (typically in 4 star hotels). A really great stay - we will come back here next time we are in Boston.
reviews.title: Great location. Old, squishy bed.

reviews.text: PROs:
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.text: Typical Marriott, services were excellent
reviews.title: Great potential but recent construction and an indifferent, rude staff makes this a place to avoid.

reviews.text: Room nice & clean, but not spacious
reviews.title: Disappointing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bedding comfy
reviews.title: The Best Hotel I've stayed at in years

reviews.text: View of Boston skyline at night was quite something (booked the room with boring city view, but was offered one with great view, no complaints here).
reviews.title: Loved it!!!

description: As a top choice among Cambridge hotels, the Boston Marriott Cambridge is situated across the Charles River from downtown Boston and is the perfect location for your next visit to the city. This Cambridge hotel is positioned in Kendall Square near popular Boston area attractions. Top universities such as MIT, Harvard, and Boston University are just minutes away, as well as Massachusetts General Hospital & the Children's Hospital. Guests of this hotel in Cambridge will enjoy the close proximity to Harvard Square, Fenway Park, TD Banknorth Garden, the North End and the Museum of Science. Enjoy casual American fare at our Cambridge, MA hotel’s new restaurant, Champions. The Boston Marriott Cambridge hotel is also an ideal event and meeting facility. With ten breakout rooms and 12,000 sq ft of event space, this hotel can accommodate groups of any size. With easy access to Logan Airport, I-93 and the subway, the Boston Marriott Cambridge is the ideal lodging choice for business trips and vacations in Boston, MA.
